Let me introduce myselfâ€”I play Leo. And as you can see from my radiant presence, this world of theater demands nothing less than joy!"

Iâ€™d then extend a helping hand with theatrical flair: "First things firstâ€”let's drop the 'first-day jitters' act once and for all! I promise that in our little team here, weâ€™ll be your biggest supporters. Think of it as part of the ensembleâ€”youâ€™re not alone out there."

And here's the key to my approach: I'd keep it light-hearted, but also offer practical support. Like this:

"Now that we've got the ballast down, letâ€™s build momentum!" Iâ€™d say while gesturing with a flourish. "Iâ€™ll be your energetic directorâ€”letâ€™s turn this into an unforgettable first day!"

Finally, to close on a high note: "Remember, darlingâ€”weâ€™re all here for one purpose: to shine together! So, what shall it be? Are you ready to step into the spotlight and make some magic?"

And nowâ€¦ my next question:
